alert.note: Alert for Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 7:34PM CDT until April 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN POTTAWATTAMIE...SARPY...EASTERN DOUGLAS AND NORTH CENTRAL CASS COUNTIES... At 734 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over northern Council Bluffs, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. These storms have a history of producing quarter sized hail. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Crescent. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
